title: Semi-log Plots - using a logarithmic scale

content.question:
​

<math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="0"><semantics><mn>0</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="3"><semantics><mn>3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="log subscript 3 open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="3"><semantics><mn>3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="4"><semantics><mn>4</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="5"><semantics><mn>5</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
​
​Consider the function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The table gives values of  <math alttext="log subscript 3 open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for selected values of <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following is a graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 2 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 1 to 4 in increments of 1. The graph is a line passing through:

(negative 1 comma 1)

(0 comma 2)

(1 comma 3)

(2 comma 4)

​

The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 2 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 3 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 0.9 comma negative 2.5).

The curve increases to cross the x axis at (negative 0.8 comma 0).

The curve continues to increase to cross the y axis at (0 comma 2).

The curve continues to increase to pass through (2 comma 3) and exit the window at (2.5 comma 3.2).

The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 2 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 9 in increments of 3. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 1.5 comma 0.5).

The curve increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma 1). 

The curve continues to increase to pass through (1 comma 3) and (2 comma 9) before exiting the window.

​

The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from 0 to 81 in increments of 9. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 1.5 comma 2).

The curve increases, passing through (0 comma 9), (1 comma 27), and (2 comma 81) before exiting the window.

content.answer:
The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from 0 to 81 in increments of 9. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 1.5 comma 2).

The curve increases, passing through (0 comma 9), (1 comma 27), and (2 comma 81) before exiting the window.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
